intro: Argostemma oliganthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
